intro: Octomeria doucetteana, commonly known as the Doucette's octomeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit with small, clustered leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
